result.execSummary:
The defendant Gilberto Suarez-Dorantes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Scanned: State Subpoena.

Defendant Gilberto Suarez-Dorantes in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Defendant waives interpreter.
AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant ordered to serve 6 months in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit of 103 days time served.  
AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant ordered to serve 6 months in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit of 103 days time served.  
The court does not order sex offender registry. 
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 4.18.16 or, if not paid, a civil judgment will be ordered.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 4.18.16 or a civil judgment is ordered.
Court orders no DV Surcharge.
Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

AMENDED COUNTS 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and elements received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6.

Defendant Gilberto Suarez-Dorantes in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Gilberto Suarez-Dorantes in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Amended information, received and filed, amending COUNTS 1 & 2 to 4TH DEGREE SEXUAL ASSAULT, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.225(3m), a Class A misdemeanor.

Copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended information, waives formal reading, momentarily pleads not guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gilberto Suarez-Dorantes in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Gilberto Suarez-Dorantes in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Interpreter waived.  

Case remains in trial posture.  State anticipates calling 13 witnesses, defense to call 1 additional witness.  Defendant does not have any relevant convictions.  Case is adjourned for jury trial on 1/25/2016.

Case calendared for scheduling conference.
Defense makes speedy trial demand.  Defendant may have immigration hold.  Jury trial will be scheduled within 90 days as required.  Defense advises that defendant may need an interpreter for trial.  Court will reserve decision on need for interpreter until final pretrial conference.  Case is adjourned for final pretrial conference on 1/13/16 at 8:30 am and jury trial scheduled on 1/25/16 at 10:00 am, Branch 6.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 08:30 am. Defendant Gilberto Suarez-Dorantes in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Gilberto Suarez-Dorantes in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Jury in box at 2:46 PM.
Statements made.
Court discharged the jury.
Jury released from jury service.

On the record, Court "DECLARED A MISTRIAL".
Court scheduled a status conference date.
Case adjourned to 11-02-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

filed by ADA Michael Thurston on behalf of the State.  Count #1 is AMENDED to:  "Attempt" 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Sexual Contact With A Child Under Age 13 [a Class B FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 948.02(1)(e), 939.50(3)(b), 939.32.  (Count #2 remains the same.)

Defendant Gilberto Suarez-Dorantes in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Gilberto Suarez-Dorantes in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Sworn as interpreter:  Daniel Lopez.

Case remains in trial posture, however defense has a speedy trial set in another court.  Court feels the case should take precedent, however court does have another case in trial posture.
STATE SUBPOENA FOR TUESDAY, OCTOBER 06, 2015 @ 9 AM  BR 6

Defendant Gilberto Suarez-Dorantes in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Gilberto Suarez-Dorantes in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.

Defense verbally objects to State's Motion to Admits Prior Bad Acts.  Arguments heard from State.  Court will allow State to admit the evidence.  Court viewed the forensic videos and finds it meets the statutory liability and rules them admissable.  Court rules the forensic videos sealed.

Case remains in trial posture.  State's witnesses subpoenaed.  State does not intend to use the defendant's statement.  No Miranda Goodchild unless State uses the statements.  No Daubert issues or special jury instructions.  Plea negotiations are concluded.  Case is adjourned for Jury trial on 10/5/2015.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.     Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 10.

Defendant Gilberto Suarez-Dorantes in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Gilberto Suarez-Dorantes in custody.  Zachary Wittchow for Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dugan, Br. 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.   Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MNV dob 6/1/02; SEC dob 5/1/06 or their family

Defendant Gilberto Suarez-Dorantes in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Gilberto Suarez-Dorantes in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
